column1: Master of Science (Technology) in Information Technology - Robotics and Artificial Intelligence
column5: Not only do robots need to understand their surroundings, they should also be able to cooperate with humans and even predict human actions. Applicants should hold a Bachelor of Science degree in computer science, mathematics, automation engineering, signal processing, or a related discipline.Students should be familiar with the basics of programming, digital logic and processors. The recommended prior learning also includes familiarity with machine learning and control engineering.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
